subject: Re: [junit] tearDown not getting called if testXXX throws exception
msgSnippet: ... No. tearDown() should always be called unless an exception is thrown in *setUp()*. At least in my installation of JUnit 3.7 this works as expected.
messageBody:
> I have noticed that tearDown() is NOT getting called (and hence does not
> cleanup) if one of my tests
> throws an exception.
>
> Is this expected behaviour?

No. tearDown() should always be called unless an exception is thrown in
*setUp()*.
At least in my installation of JUnit 3.7 this works as expected.

Johannes
